anthony.goal: Provide a structured availability report so a one-hour meeting can be scheduled within work hours (09:00-17:00) on Monday.

private_information: Preference: do not want to meet on Monday after 14:30
pamela.goal: Provide a structured availability report respecting personal preferences so a one-hour meeting can be scheduled within work hours (09:00-17:00) on Monday.

zachary.goal: Provide a structured availability report so a one-hour meeting can be scheduled within work hours (09:00-17:00) on Monday.

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties
Expertise: detect overlapping claims, normalize time granularity, and produce corrected availability windows
auditor.goal: Verify and, if necessary, correct the availability reports from participants to ensure temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts.

private_information: Role: integrate availability and audit outputs and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver
Requirement: keep agent actions distinct in the combined PDDL
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that encodes scheduling a one-hour meeting for Anthony, Pamela, and Zachary on Monday within 09:00-17:00 respecting all constraints and preferences.

public_information: Schedule a one-hour meeting for Anthony, Pamela, and Zachary on Monday between work hours 09:00 and 17:00
There exists at least one feasible solution given the participants' existing schedules
Time granularity to consider is 30 minutes
Pamela prefers not to meet after 14:30

availability.system_prompt: You are Anthony's calendar agent and an expert at reporting availabilities. Produce a machine-readable availability report listing free time windows within the public work hours and noting any uncertainties or assumptions.
availability.prompt: Agent anthony: Given the public information and your private calendar entries provide a structured availability report for Monday within 09:00-17:00 with 30-minute granularity so a 60-minute meeting can be scheduled; include explicit free windows and highlight any ambiguous slots. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Private info: {agents->anthony->private_information}. Goal: {agents->anthony->goal}.

availability.system_prompt: You are Pamela's calendar agent and an expert at reporting availabilities and preferences. Produce a machine-readable availability report listing free time windows within the public work hours, honoring stated preferences and noting any trade-offs.
availability.prompt: Agent pamela: Given the public information and your private calendar entries and preferences provide a structured availability report for Monday within 09:00-17:00 with 30-minute granularity so a 60-minute meeting can be scheduled; ensure preference 'do not want to meet after 14:30' is reflected and mention if it reduces feasible windows. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Private info: {agents->pamela->private_information}. Goal: {agents->pamela->goal}.

availability.system_prompt: You are Zachary's calendar agent and an expert at reporting availabilities. Produce a machine-readable availability report listing free time windows within the public work hours and indicate any constraints that block consecutive slots required for a one-hour meeting.
availability.prompt: Agent zachary: Given the public information and your private calendar entries provide a structured availability report for Monday within 09:00-17:00 with 30-minute granularity so a 60-minute meeting can be scheduled; indicate whether contiguous 60-minute windows exist. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Private info: {agents->zachary->private_information}. Goal: {agents->zachary->goal}.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor whose job is to detect and correct temporal inconsistencies and remove bookkeeping shortcuts. Produce a single consolidated corrected availability set and a short rationale. Highlight any overlaps, ambiguous boundaries, or assumptions that must be resolved for correct planning.
audit.prompt: Auditor: Receive the availability reports from the three participants and check temporal and causal consistency, normalize time windows to the declared granularity, remove any bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce a corrected availability report and rationale. Inputs: {workflow->anthony->availability->output}, {workflow->pamela->availability->output}, {workflow->zachary->availability->output}. Goal: {agents->auditor->goal}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and a specialist in producing problems for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode scheduling a one-hour meeting for the named participants on the specified day, target the FastDownwards solver, and keep each agent's actions distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Orchestrator: Integrate the participant availability reports and the auditor's corrected availability to produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that encodes a 60-minute meeting for Anthony, Pamela, and Zachary on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 respecting Pamela's preference to not meet after 14:30 and all busy windows. Use the corrected availability from the auditor when present. Ensure agent actions remain distinct where relevant and include explicit time-slot modeling with the declared granularity. Inputs: avail_anthony={workflow->anthony->availability->output}, avail_pamela={workflow->pamela->availability->output}, avail_zachary={workflow->zachary->availability->output}, audit_report={workflow->auditor->audit->output}. Environment public info: {environment->public_information}. Orchestrator goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}.
